questions.question_text: Which of the following measurements would give the project manager the BEST estimate of the total cost of an active project?

choices.B: Update the project management plan based on the change.
choices.A: Notify the team that the change has been made.
choices.C: Proceed to the next task in the project schedule.
choices.D: Conduct an impact analysis to verify there is no collateral damage.

discussion.content: This is D...come on man.
D for sure

Selected Answer: D
The project manager should conduct an impact analysis to verify there is no collateral damage. While the new functionality provided by the customer may be an improvement, the project manager needs to ensure that implementing this change does not have a negative impact on other aspects of the project, such as the budget or schedule. Conducting an impact analysis will help the project manager evaluate the potential impact of the change and determine if any additional actions or adjustments are necessary. Once the impact analysis is complete, the project manager can then update the project management plan based on the change and proceed with notifying the team and continuing with the project schedule. Therefore, the correct answer is D.

questions.question_text:
A customer approaches a team member to report that old functionality is no longer valid due to technology restrictions. The team member has also noticed this during the execution of the project. The team member agrees with the new functionality provided by the customer, implements the change, and notifies the project manager.
Which of the following actions should the project manager take NEXT?

A project manager at a projectized organization is resource leveling the upcoming phase. The project manager notices one of the resources is assigned with 20% of allocation to a secondary project. This situation limits and jeopardizes the commitment date.
Which of the following should the project manager do NEXT?

discussion.content: A projectized organization does not have functional managers in the traditional sense. In a projectized organization, all resources are assigned to projects full-time and report to the project manager. The project manager has complete control over the resources and is responsible for managing them, as well as managing the project itself. Therefore, in a projectized organization, there is no need for functional managers.

Selected Answer: B
The project sponsor is responsible for removing roadblocks.

Selected Answer: B
Prioritize Projects as per Strategic Business Objectives
 PMO plays a crucial role in this process and carries the following responsibilities:

Ensure that the programs and portfolios are aligned to operational and strategic objectives
Projects are selected and prioritized as per these business goals
Enterprise resources are allocated and utilized as per business goals
Design and track various program and portfolio performance KPIs
If the PM is in a projectized environment, why would they consult the a functional manager?
The functional manager shouldn't really hold any decision making power in a projectized organization. Think the answer should be D, but it is definitely not A.
